title: Introduction to Climate Breakdown
headline: Learn how to respond to global climate change in this free online course that explains the term ‘climate breakdown’.
description: This sustainable development course explains climate breakdown and provides some actions we can take to address this critical environmental issue. We delve into the science behind this pressing issue and explain how goals like net zero greenhouse gas emissions can help mitigate the harm done to the planet by industry. Sign up to explore this major environmental issue and learn what it means to us and future generations and what can be done.

courseDescription:
The world is currently on the edge of an environmental crisis that may have profound implications for the continuing existence of humanity as climate breakdown will affect the entire planet. If more people understand this critical issue and its consequences, there will be a greater chance that we make the necessary changes to all aspects of our lives. These changes include the policies enacted by our governments, the ways we interact with each other, how we do business and how we travel.

The course includes a series of short animations, text sections and knowledge checks. Richard, the course developer, presents the course material and is helped by Kate, a climate scientist. We define ‘climate breakdown’, identify the importance of net zero goals and explain how climate breakdown will impact the future. Kate explains the greenhouse effect, the role of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases and why we should be aware of ‘tipping points’. The course also discusses some measures we could adopt to avoid the worst effects of climate breakdown. We also discuss how we adapt to its consequences.

The course asserts that the changes in the climate we are experiencing are caused by mankind and our actions. Many people now recognise the importance of climate breakdown but are unwilling to make the changes necessary to avoid the worst effects. This course addresses current and urgent concerts and is of interest to anyone, but particularly suits those working in the field of environmental management or anyone seeking employment as environmental compliance officers, environmental field technicians or health, safety and environmental specialists. Sign up to understand how human activity drives global climate change and learn what you can do to address it.
